definition: the fact that something consists of or is arranged in lines
the fact that something goes from one thing to another in a single series of stages
the fact that something can be represented by a straight line on a graph
the quality of being accurate or true, without any mistakes
the quality of being right and suitable, so that something is done as it should be done
care in the way that you speak or behave so that you follow the accepted standards or rules
the highest point or end of something, usually happening after a long time
a large, heavy book, especially one dealing with a serious topic
the opinions that somebody has about something and expresses publicly
the way in which somebody stands, especially when playing a sport
the position in which you hold your body when standing or sitting
your attitude to a particular situation or the way in which you deal with it
to show an image of somebody/something in a picture
to describe something in words, or give an impression of something in words or with a picture
a structure made of wood or wire supported with posts that is put between two areas of land as a boundary, or around a garden, field, etc. to keep animals in, or to keep people and animals out
a structure that horses must jump over in a race or a competition
a criminal who buys and sells stolen goods
said about people who never seem happy with what they have and always think they could be happier in a different place or situation
to find a solution when you disagree with somebody
used to refer to either of two opposite opinions on an issue
to avoid becoming involved in deciding or influencing something
the quality of being a god or like God or a god
a god or goddess
the study of the nature of God and religious belief
a god or goddess
God
to control or have a lot of influence over somebody/something, especially in an unpleasant way
to be the most important or noticeable feature of something
to be the largest, highest or most obvious thing in a place
to play much better than your opponent in a game
to make a copy of a picture, piece of text, etc.
to produce something very similar to something else in a different medium or context; to make something happen again in the same way
if people, plants, animals, etc. reproduce or reproduce themselves, they produce young
an amount of money that is paid to somebody for the work they have done
having a shape like a rectangle (= a flat shape with four straight sides, two of which are longer than the other two, and four angles of 90°)
